intro: Chenopodium berlandieri var. boscianum, commonly known as prickly goosefoot, is a species of flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is native to North America and is characterized by its rough, spiny leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in prairies, roadsides, and other open areas. It has a sprawling growth habit and produces small, edible seeds that are sometimes used in traditional foods. The plant is also known for its adaptability to various environmental conditions.
